en: Over the Rhine with the 79th Infantry Division
Over the Rhine with the 79th Infantry Division -- Duisburg (Germany)
Over the Rhine with the 79th Infantry Division -- Rhine River (Germany)
Canvas for Over the Rhine with the 79th Infantry Division

body.value: Cartoon of troops crossing the Rhine under fire north of Duisburg
Cartoon of devastated cities in the Ruhr region during the clearing of the Ruhr Pocket, March-April 1945.

"And, on May 9, 'Victory in Europe Day,' the 79th Division was engaged in government of more than 1,000 square miles of the industrial Ruhr Valley.  Each man was filled with pride in his combat record and confidence in the future."

American soldiers looking confused as they provide supplies for Displaced Persons (DPs), marked by flags from various European nations.  There were more than 100,000 DPs in the Ruhr area under the direct supervision of the 79th.

Caption: "So, from Pont-a-Mousson through Luxembourg, over the bloody ground of the Ardennes Bulge, thorugh Liege to Tongeren, in Belgium.  Some by train and some by truck, the division moved into place behind the Ninth Army. Passes to Brussels and Liege - 'Ja, Ja" instead of "Oui, Oui"
Unit crest of the 79th Infantry Division - Over the Rhine. With hand written "Map No. 4"
